Viewing the Upper Pane

The upper right pane of the main window contains a tree or list of items. Its contents depend upon all of the following factors:

  • The folder selected from the folder hierarchy on the left.

  • The component tab selected from the upper pane.

  • The filter selected from the Filter drop-down list, which appears above the upper right pane.

  • The  All Descendants button, above the upper right pane, which determines the depth for which the application displays information.

    • When not selected, the application displays information for the selected folder only.

    • When selected, the application displays information for the selected folder, its children, its children’s children, and so on.

Sorting data

Clicking a column header sorts the displayed data based on the value in that column. The initial sort order for most columns is ascending alphanumeric. To change the sort order from ascending to descending (or vice versa), click the header a second time. For information on advanced sorting, see Sorting and Grouping Data.

Creating filters, queries, and sort orders

Right-click a column header to display a context menu that allows you to select or create filters, queries, and sort orders. The same menu options appear on the menu for each item, under Filters.

Refreshing data

The contents of the upper pane can be refreshed in several ways:

  • To refresh the entire view, press F5.

  • To refresh only the upper pane, press Shift + F5.

  • To refresh the upper pane and simultaneously collapse any groups displayed in that pane, press Ctrl + F5.

  • To refresh data for PVCS or VSS archives, press F6.
